ActivateSubscribe.document: This API is used to configure a data subscription, which can be called only for subscription instances in unconfigured status.
ActivateSubscribe.name: Configures data subscription channel

CompleteMigrateJob.document:
This API (CompleteMigrateJob) is used to complete a data migration task.
For tasks in incremental migration mode, you need to call this API before migration gets ready, so as to stop migrating incremental data.
If the task status queried through the (DescribeMigrateJobs) API is ready (status=8), you can call this API to complete the migration task.
CompleteMigrateJob.name: Completes a data migration task

CreateMigrateCheckJob.document:
This API is used to create a migration check task.
Before migration, you should call this API to create a check. Migration will start only if the check succeeds. You can view the check result through the `DescribeMigrateCheckJob` API.
After successful check, if the migration task needs to be modified, a new check task should be created and migration will begin only after the new check succeeds.

For a finance zone link, use the domain name https://dts.ap-shenzhen-fsi.tencentcloudapi.com.
CreateMigrateCheckJob.name: Creates a migration check task

CreateMigrateJob.document:
This API (CreateMigrateJob) is used to create a data migration task.

For a finance zone linkage, please use the domain name dts.ap-shenzhen-fsi.tencentcloudapi.com.
CreateMigrateJob.name: Creates a data migration task

CreateSubscribe.document: This API is used to create a data subscription instance.
CreateSubscribe.name: Creates subscription object

DeleteMigrateJob.document: This API (DeleteMigrationJob) is used to delete a data migration task. If the task status queried through the DescribeMigrateJobs API is checking (status=3), running (status=7), ready (status=8), canceling (status=11), or completing (status=12), the task cannot be deleted.
DeleteMigrateJob.name: Deletes a data migration task

DescribeAsyncRequestInfo.document: This API is used to query the execution result of a task.
DescribeAsyncRequestInfo.name: Queries task execution result

DescribeMigrateCheckJob.document:
This API is used to get the check result and query check status and progress after a check is created. 
If the check succeeds, you can call the StartMigrateJob API to start migration.
If the check fails, the reason can be queried. Please modify the migration configuration or adjust relevant parameters of the source/target instances through the ModifyMigrateJob API based on the error message.
DescribeMigrateCheckJob.name: Gets the migration check result

DescribeMigrateJobs.document:
This API is used to query data migration tasks.
For a finance zone linkage, please use the domain name https://dts.ap-shenzhen-fsi.tencentcloudapi.com.
DescribeMigrateJobs.name: Queries data migration tasks

DescribeRegionConf.document: This API is used to query the purchasable subscription instance regions.
DescribeRegionConf.name: Queries purchasable subscription instance regions

DescribeSubscribeConf.document: This API is used to query the subscription instance configuration.
DescribeSubscribeConf.name: Queries subscription instance configuration

DescribeSubscribes.document: This API is used to get the information list of data subscription instances. Pagination is enabled by default with 20 results returned each time.
DescribeSubscribes.name: Gets data subscription instance list

IsolateSubscribe.document: This API is used to isolate an hourly billed subscription instance. After this API is called, the instance will become unavailable and billing will stop for it.
IsolateSubscribe.name: Isolates subscription instance

ModifyMigrateJob.document:
This API (ModifyMigrateJob) is used to modify a data migration task.
If the status of a migration task is creating (status=1), check succeeded (status=4), check failed (status=5), or migration failed (status=10), this API can be called to modify the task, but the type of the source and target instances and the region of the target instance cannot be modified.

For a finance zone linkage, please use the domain name dts.ap-shenzhen-fsi.tencentcloudapi.com.
ModifyMigrateJob.name: Modifies a data migration task

ModifySubscribeConsumeTime.document: This API is used to modify the consumption time point of a data subscription channel.
ModifySubscribeConsumeTime.name: Modifies the consumption time point of data subscription instance channel

ModifySubscribeName.document: This API is used to rename a data subscription instance.
ModifySubscribeName.name: Renames data subscription instance

ModifySubscribeObjects.document: This API is used to modify the subscription rule of a data subscription channel.
ModifySubscribeObjects.name: Modifies the subscription rule of data subscription channel

ModifySubscribeVipVport.document: This API is used to modify the IP and port number of a data subscription instance.
ModifySubscribeVipVport.name: Modifies the IP and port number of data subscription instance

OfflineIsolatedSubscribe.document: This API is used to deactivate an isolated data subscription instance.
OfflineIsolatedSubscribe.name: Deactivates isolated data subscription instance

ResetSubscribe.document: This API is used to reset a data subscription instance. Once reset, an activated instance can be bound to other database instances through the `ActivateSubscribe` API.
ResetSubscribe.name: Resets data subscription instance

StartMigrateJob.document:
This API (StartMigrationJob) is used to start a migration task. After the API is called, non-scheduled migration tasks will start the migration immediately, while scheduled tasks will start the countdown.
Before calling this API, be sure to use the CreateMigrateCheckJob API to check the data migration task, which can be started only if its status queried through the DescribeMigrateJobs API is check succeeded (status=4).
StartMigrateJob.name: Starts a migration task

StopMigrateJob.document:
This API (StopMigrateJob) is used to cancel a data migration task.
During migration, this API can be used to cancel migration if the task status queried through the DescribeMigrateJobs API is running (status=7) or ready (status=8), and the migration task will fail.
StopMigrateJob.name: Cancels a data migration task

members.document: Subscription instance ID.
members.name: SubscribeId

members.document: Database Instance ID
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Data subscription type. 0: full instance subscription, 1: data subscription, 2: structure subscription, 3: data subscription and structure subscription

members.document: Subscription object
members.name: Objects

members.name: UniqSubnetId

members.document: Subscription service port. Default value: 7507
members.name: Vport

members.document: Data subscription configuration task ID.
members.name: AsyncRequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Data migration task ID
members.name: JobId

members.document: The way to complete the task, which is supported only for legacy MySQL migration task. waitForSync: wait for the source-replica lag to become 0 before stopping; immediately: complete immediately without waiting for source-replica sync. Default value: waitForSync
members.name: CompleteMode

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Data content check parameter, which refers to the proportion of the rows selected for data comparison in all the rows of the table. Value: an integer between 1 and 100.
members.name: SelectRowsPerTable

members.document: Data content check parameter, which refers to the proportion of the tables selected for data detection in all the tables. Value: an integer between 1 and 100.
members.name: TablesSelectAll

members.document: Data quantity check parameter, which checks whether the numbers of rows are identical. It refers to the proportion of the tables selected for quantity check in all the tables. Value: an integer between 1 and 100.
members.name: TablesSelectCount

members.document: Data migration task ID
members.name: JobId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Data migration task name
members.name: JobName

members.document: Migration task configuration options
members.name: MigrateOption

members.document: Source instance database type, which currently supports MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Percona, and SQL Server. For more information on the supported types in a specific region, see the migration task creation page in the console.
members.name: SrcDatabaseType

members.document: Source instance access type. Valid values: extranet (public network), cvm (CVM-based self-created instance), dcg (Direct Connect-enabled instance), vpncloud (Tencent Cloud VPN-enabled instance), cdb (TencentDB instance), ccn (CCN instance)
members.name: SrcAccessType

members.document: Source instance information, which is correlated with the migration task type
members.name: SrcInfo

members.document: Target instance access type, which currently supports MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, and Percona, SQL Server, and TDSQL-C for MySQL. For more information on the supported types in a specific region, see the migration task creation page in the console.
members.name: DstDatabaseType

members.document: Target instance access type, which currently only supports cdb (TencentDB instance)
members.example: cdb                              // 目标实例是腾讯云mysql
members.name: DstAccessType

members.document: Destination instance information
members.name: DstInfo

members.document:
Information of the source table to be migrated, which is described in JSON string format. It is required if MigrateOption.MigrateObject is 2 (migrating the specified table).
For databases with a database-table structure:
[{"Database":"db1","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db2"}]
For databases with a database-schema-table structure:
[{"Database":"db1","Schema":"s1","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db1","Schema":"s2","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db2","Schema":"s1","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db3"},{"Database":"db4","Schema":"s1"}]
members.name: DatabaseInfo

members.document: Tag of the instance to be migrated.
members.name: Tags

members.document: Source instance type. `simple`: Primary/Secondary node; `cluster`: Cluster node. If this field is left empty, the value defaults to primary/secondary node.

members.name: Count

members.document: Whether to auto-renew. Default value: 0. This flag does not take effect for hourly billed instances (this field should be hidden from global site users)

members.name: ExpectTime

members.name: MigrateType

members.document: Migration subject. 1: entire instance; 2: specified table
members.name: MigrateObject

members.document: Parameter of spot data consistency check. 1: not configured; 2: full check; 3: spot check; 4: check inconsistent tables only; 5: no check
members.name: ConsistencyType

members.document: Whether to overwrite the target database with the root account of the source database. Value range: 0 (no), 1 (yes). This value should be 0 for table or structural migration
members.name: IsOverrideRoot

members.document:
Additional parameters for different databases, which are described in JSON format. 
The following parameters can be defined for Redis: 
{ 
	"ClientOutputBufferHardLimit":512, 	Hard capacity limit of slave buffer (MB) 
	"ClientOutputBufferSoftLimit":512, 	Soft capacity limit of slave buffer (MB) 
	"ClientOutputBufferPersistTime":60, Soft limit duration of slave buffer (s) 
	"ReplBacklogSize":512, 	Circular buffer capacity limit (MB) 
	"ReplTimeout":120, 		Replication timeout period (s) 
}
The following parameters can be defined for MongoDB: 
{
	'SrcAuthDatabase':'admin', 
	'SrcAuthFlag': "1", 
	'SrcAuthMechanism':"SCRAM-SHA-1"
}
MySQL currently does not support configuring additional parameters.
members.name: ExternParams

members.document: Only used for "spot data consistency check". It is required if ConsistencyType is spot check
members.name: ConsistencyParams

members.document: Step number
members.name: StepNo

members.document: Step name
members.name: StepName

members.document: Step ID
members.name: StepId

members.document: Step status. Value range: 0 (default), 1 (succeeded), 2 (failed), 3 (in progress), 4 (not started)
members.name: Status

members.document:
Start time of current step in the format of `yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss`. This field is meaningless if it does not exist or is empty
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Target instance access type. Valid values: extranet (public network), cvm (CVM-based self-created instance), dcg (Direct Connect-enabled instance), vpncloud (Tencent Cloud VPN-enabled instance), cdb (TencentDB instance). Currently, only `cdb` is supported
members.name: DstAccessType

members.document: Target instance information. The region where the target instance is located cannot be modified.
members.name: DstInfo

members.document:
When migrating the specified table, you need to set the information of the source database table to be migrated, which should be described in JSON string format. Below are examples.

For databases with a database-table structure:
[{"Database":"db1","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db2"}]
For databases with a database-schema-table structure:
[{"Database":"db1","Schema":"s1","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db1","Schema":"s2","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db2","Schema":"s1","Table":["table1","table2"]},{"Database":"db3"},{"Database":"db4","Schema":"s1"}]

This field does not need to be set when the entire instance is to be migrated
members.name: DatabaseInfo

Data subscription object type. 0: database, 1: database table
